actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XX of the Social Security Act to provide that any individual 60 years of age or over may conclusively establish financial eligibility for services thereunder by filing a written statement that his or her income is within the limits required by law.

summary.text: Amends Title XX (Grants to States for Services) of the Social Security Act to permit any individual 60 years of age or over to conclusively establish financial eligibility for services thereunder by filing a written statement that his or her income is within the limits required by law.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XX of the Social Security Act to provide that any individual 60 years of age or over may conclusively establish financial eligibility for services thereunder by filing a written statement that his or her income is within the limits required by law.
